>@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.hIhgdXnqGHBm0A64]{Envoy Improvisation}

@Icon[type:sense-dependent] Sense-Dependent

As a standard action, you can fake out an enemy within 60 feet, making that enemy open to your attacks. Attempt a @Check[type:bluff] with the same DC as a check to feint against that enemy (though this isn’t a standard check to feint, so @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.feats.11cfGGiQ9oTi4f9G]{Improved Feint} and @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.feats.YL1fs0mA5Gpb7sdV]{Greater Feint} don’t apply). Even if you fail, that enemy is @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.MZ8OoH1GE9qDMyCD]{Flat-Footed} against your attacks (see page 276) until the end of your next turn. If you succeed, the enemy is also @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.MZ8OoH1GE9qDMyCD]{Flat-Footed} against your allies’ attacks until the end of your next turn. You can’t use clever feint against a creature that lacks an Intelligence score.

At 6th level, you can spend 1 Resolve Point to treat a failed @Check[type:bluff] for clever feint as if it were a success.
